Voter Question: Are Absentee Ballots Confidential?
Answer: Yes!

The process: The Ballot envelope is authenticated as a resident address, and that it is signed. After it is authenticated, it is opened the envelope is placed in a separate box and set aside. The folded ballot within is taken out, without unfolding it, and placed into a ballot box with hundreds of others. The ballots are later opened to be counted. The Ballot itself has no identifying information on it, retaining confidentiality. This is a rigorous process, which has been checked by our School Attorneys, and has been in practice here for Absentee Ballots for many years.

For more information please go to www.heightsschools.com

Absentee Ballots must be received by 5pm at the District Office on June 9th to be counted.

This week we mark Teacher Appreciation Week and safe to say, this year it is unlike any other.

Our teachers are facing unprecedented challenges and, here in the Heights, they have answered the call, finding new and imaginative ways to engage with students and continue to touch their lives despite the distance we are forced to maintain.

We would be remiss if we didn’t also recognize all the others; parents, grandparents, guardians, siblings, everyone who find themselves in the role of teachers, or teachers helpers, in these unprecedented times.

The African Proverb says “It takes a village to raise a child” and here in Elmira Heights we try to live by those words, now more than ever.

Thank you all! You are truly appreciated for everything you do #FortheHeights

Michael Gill, Superintendent

Both locations will operate Monday-Friday from 10:30-11:30 a.m.

The program is available at no charge for children 18 years old and younger from the district who are in need during the school shutdown. Children enrolled in the district, and siblings who reside in the same household, may participate.
